title: Graph of function to analyze derivatives

content.question: The graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB2@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is shown above. Which of the following could be the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>h</mi> <mo>â€²</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EBE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: A symmetric power function graph with a decreasing slope is plotted on a coordinate plane. It starts from the second quadrant and slopes downward to enter the first quadrant, cutting the positive y axis. It then enters the fourth quadrant cutting the positive axis. It appears sloping downward as it enters the fourth quadrant.

A graph starts from third quadrant and intersects the negative x axis at a point. It further increases in the shape of a root curve and intersects positive y axis at a point, and finally terminates in the first quadrant.

A parabola that opens downward is plotted on a coordinate plane. It has its left x-intercept lying in the third quadrant and right x-intercept lying in the fourth quadrant. The vertex of the parabola lies at a point on the positive y axis.
A coordinate plane shows an upward opening parabola having vertex at negative y axis. The ends of the parabola are slightly curved and fall in first and third quadrants, respectively.

A parabola that opens upward is plotted on a coordinate plane. It has its left x-intercept lying in the second quadrant and right x-intercept lying in the first quadrant. The vertex of the parabola lies at a point on the negative y axis.

content.answer: A parabola that opens upward is plotted on a coordinate plane. It has its left x-intercept lying in the second quadrant and right x-intercept lying in the first quadrant. The vertex of the parabola lies at a point on the negative y axis.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
